p.s: The given extract from scene three of Ayad Akhtar's play Disgraced, Scene 3 deals with the violent climax of a heated argument at a dinner party.
In the beginning of the extract, Jory and Amir return to the apartment after going out to buy a bottle of champagne.
Jory is in utter shock because she sees her husband Isaac and Amir's wife Emily kiss, as soon as she enters the door.
Amir, still fuming because he was just told by Jory that she was promoted instead of him, enters soon after and catches up to what allegedly happened.
Emily and Isaac deny having kissed and claim that they were hugging because Emily is upset about Amir not being promoted at his lawfirm.
Consequently, Amir confronts Jory for destroying his marriage, therefore implying that he believes that Jory is lying and Isaac and Emily did not kiss.
Furthermore, Amir reveals how much effort he put into his work at the law firm and implies that he did not get equal chances due to his belief and origin.
When the conflict gets physical, Amir spits in Isaac's face, whereafter Isaac insults Amir for his former Muslim belief.
Amir asks Jory to leave too, but before she does so, Jory elaborates how Amir did not get promoted due to his duplicious identity.
After the guests both leave, Amir pressures his wife into admitting that she has slept with Isaac on a trip to London.
Overwhelmed by his emotions and filled with resentment, Amir proceeds to beat his wife in rapid succession.
When he realises what he has done, he is filled with regret.
